intro: Frasera cusickii, commonly known as the Cusick's frasera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is perennial and often grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
